text: I’m gonna bust up in on this party… any word on this?
<@UHNBCT0Q1> given that that looks like a test submission, can you confirm that the submissions are not coming from an IP address that’s been filtered out of tracking?
Hey Zack, what would be the best way of confirming this?
If your public IP address falls in the Exclude traffic section as described here <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/reports/exclude-traffic-from-your-site-analytics>
<@U3T21PDBK> are you experiencing the same thing?  Any examples of what you are seeing would be helpful in troubleshooting this
As far as I'm aware, we're not excluding any traffic
In that case, can you DM me a contact where you would expect to see a source other than Direct but is showing as direct traffic

Occasional non-association of contact and deal via Ecomm bridge, have anyone encountered that?

I ran a simple test recently sending a 100 deals to our test portal via Ecomm bridge. Out of those, 32 deals ended up in HubSpot with no contact associated.

I checked, and each and every contact for those 32 deals was created (Original source drill-down 1 = `INTEGRATIONS_SYNC`), it's just the association isn't there.

I'm having a hard time pinpointing a problem, and all API requests were successful, maybe someone has encountered this before?
Were those contacts previously deleted by chance?

Hey Zack

nope, they were all brand new, generated uniquely for each deal
ok, do you have access to support?  If you can create a ticket with the JSON of the sync messages you’ve sent in for the test you just ran, we can look into it as it sounds like a bug

Sure, yeah, I'll do that
tnx
